abstract.p: Third-quarter profit at Canada's TD Bank Financial Group rose 21 percent on 41 percent increase in revenue, reflecting acquisition of Canada Trust; profit was 511 million Canadian dollars ($347 million); revenue was 2.6 billion Canadian dollars; president Edmund Clark says TD Bank has reached agreement to sell 13 branches and Canada Trust's MasterCard business, two conditions for federal approval of its takeover of Canada Trust (S)

block.p: Third-quarter profit at the TD Bank Financial Group, the big Canadian bank, rose 21 percent on a 41 percent increase in revenue, reflecting the acquisition late last year of Canada Trust. Profit was 511 million Canadian dollars ($347 million), or 80 Canadian cents a share, beating the consensus estimate of 72 cents by analysts polled by First Call/Thomson Financial. Revenue was 2.6 billion Canadian dollars. The president, Edmund Clark, said TD Bank had reached agreements to sell 13 branches and Canada Trust's MasterCard business, two conditions for federal approval of its takeover of Canada Trust.

Third-quarter profit at the TD Bank Financial Group, the big Canadian bank, rose 21 percent on a 41 percent increase in revenue, reflecting the acquisition late last year of Canada Trust. Profit was 511 million Canadian dollars ($347 million), or 80 Canadian cents a share, beating the consensus estimate of 72 cents by analysts polled by First Call/Thomson Financial. Revenue was 2.6 billion Canadian dollars. The president, Edmund Clark, said TD Bank had reached agreements to sell 13 branches and Canada Trust's MasterCard business, two conditions for federal approval of its takeover of Canada Trust.
